mision.texto: To contribute to the integral development of communities surrounding the Pico de Orizaba National Park by strengthening their social, economic, and environmental resilience.

vision.descripcion: We aspire to be a benchmark of inclusive and sustainable community transformation.
lista: Preserve and restore the environment of the Pico de Orizaba National Park.
Ensure basic services and reduce marginalization and social lag.
Improve the quality of education and health.
Promote local and solidarity-based economic development that generates decent jobs.
Channel the strength and leadership of youth as a driver of transformation.
Exercise good governance and financial transparency, inspiring trust among donors and allies.

equipo.descripcion: Our team is made up of people committed to community well-being, social justice, and environmental protection.

cPreguntas.descripcion: Here we answer your most common questions.

ubicacion.respuesta: Our main center is located at Av. Principal #123, City. We also have service points in several areas.

rescate.pregunta: I rescued a dog, where should I take it?
rescate.respuesta: You can bring it to our rescue center from 9am to 5pm. If you need transportation assistance, contact us to coordinate.

adopcion.pregunta: I want to adopt, what is the process?
adopcion.respuesta: 1) Fill out the online form, 2) Schedule an interview, 3) Home visit, 4) Sign the adoption contract. The process takes around one week.

entregar.pregunta: How can I put my dog up for adoption?
entregar.respuesta: You need to schedule an evaluation appointment. We require medical history and the reason for surrender.

veterinario.respuesta: Yes, we have a clinic that provides basic veterinary services, primarily for rescued animals.

maltrato.pregunta: How can I report animal abuse?
maltrato.respuesta: You can report it through our confidential form or by calling 555-1234.

donativos.pregunta: What kind of donations do you need?
donativos.respuesta: Food, medicine, blankets, toys, and monetary donations. Everything is welcome.
